column2: The Tremere Code marks the clan as unique among Cainites, no other group adheres to a unified set of rules that delineate acceptable behavior. No compelling magic binds any Tremere to the oath, unless some stern regent actively decides to enforce it, instead, the code is a de facto listing of what constitutes acceptable behavior for a member of the august House of Tremere.
Most of the leaders of House Tremere are members of the Inner Circle, Tremere's shadowy council.
Path of the Beast leader description
Path of Power and the Inner Voice
Path of Power and the Inner Voice
Path of Power and the Inner Voice description
Path of Power and the Inner Voice leader description
Path of the Night leader description

Those who become Seekers live lonely, introverted lives as they discover their own capabilities. They rely on riddles and fragments of information, and usually give similar answers in return. Most unusually, especially for the flesh-shaping Tzimisce, those that follow the road usually reject their own malleable flesh for perfection of the spirit.
Path of the Hive leader description
Path of Death and the Soul
Path of Death and the Soul
Path of Death and the Soul description
Path of Death and the Soul leader description
Path of Honorable Accord leader description
Path of Evil Revelations leader description
Followers of Via Humanitatis use the human condition to fight their Beast, remembering that they were ordinary mortals before being bestowed with Caine's curse.
The Ashen Prodigal are the heirs of the Pact of Athens, the exalted conclave that lays foundation to the Via.
Followers of Via Regalis control their Beast by ruling over others. Mortals are inferior, promises will be fulfilled, and power is everything.
The true Kings and Queens of Via Regalis are paragon of virtue, duty and honor.

Followers of Via Bestiae control their Beast through the primal concepts of survival, strength, and individuality. Many members of the Road of the Beast choose a simple, animalistic existence to best serve the beliefs of Via Bestiae, while others follow it by living a simplistic existence, akin to barbarians.
The Lorekeepers gather the knowledge and traditions of Via Bestiae and keeps them safe and circulating among the Ferals.

Followers of Via Peccati control their Beast by indulging their whims and desires, regardless of who they hurt. Failure to do as they please makes their condition worse, which means morals, ethics, and laws usually fall by the wayside as they make their way along this Road.
Paragons of decadence, these Cainites have seen many civilizations fall into debauchery and chaos... and they loved it.

Followers of Via Caeli attempt to control their Beast through religious devotion. To follow the Road of Heaven basically means that any Noddist will love and serve God, follow and obey the rules already laid out by Him (the Ten Commandments being a prime example), and will not act in ways that empower the Devil.
The leaders of the Via Caeli are teachers, holy men and exemplars of what a faithful Cainite should aspire to be.

Those who follow Via Sanguinus are among the most deadly to their fellow Cainites, as the act of diablerie is almost a rite of purification among the Sentinels. Indeed, one of the main tenets of the road is for its followers to purge all that are unworthy of the blood of Caine and purify the bloodlines, one who shows a dark, dishonorable nature to a follower of Via Sanguinus may be in for a rude awakening.
Traditionally an Assamite of the Warrior Caste, Elders are the shadow kingmakers of Europe, punishing the unworthy wherever they take shelter.

The followers of Via Ossium value knowledge above anything else. By intense study of the unknown, the Scholars keep their Beasts at bay. They will go to nearly any lengths to learn something new, but will not needlessly sacrifice themselves for a cause. After all, their own gathered knowledge is too important to let others handle.
These Cainites have mastered the science and art of Death. Some say they have become it themselves.

Those who become Seekers live lonely, introverted lives as they discover their own capabilities. They rely on riddles and fragments of information, and usually give similar answers in return. Most unusually, especially for the flesh-shaping Tzimisce, those that follow the road usually reject their own malleable flesh for perfection of the spirit.
Leaders of Via Mutationis are inscrutable creatures, in constant flux. Stagnation is death to them.

The Redeemers actively go about the world of man, punishing and killing mortal sinners. Some followers of Via Noctis offer penance for lesser deeds, and still others will Embrace irredeemable mortals to help them in their punishment. They also target Cainites who would tempt mortals into corruption, outstanding examples being the Followers of Set and the Baali.
Merciless angels of the dark, these Cainites are the bane of wrongdoers, be they Cainites or otherwise.

The goal of Via Paradoxi adherents is to guide everyone to their higher destiny. If needed, this includes death, especially for Kindred they view as wayward and having fallen from their true destiny. Mortals are safer from these fatal punishments, as they are more directly involved with the life cycle of the universe.
Lacking any true organization, Via Paradoxi leaders are mostly loners, bound by fate and duty like no other.

Perhaps no road is as clan-centered as Via Serpentis, as the Road of the Serpent holds one purpose: to honor Set and his works. At the same time, the Tempters work to free themselves from the reign of Osiris. The Tempters view him as abusive of his power and repressive, and so seek to undermine his laws at any opportunity.
Emblems of liberty and sweet debauchery, the paragons of Via Serpentis exhude appeal and flair.

Via Einherjar is a Road practiced among the Norse vampires and serves as a reminder of the ancient ethics that the All-Father gave them. The Road teaches responsibility, courage in the face of adversity, and individual initiative. Many drive off the Beast by acts of iron-willed discipline and courage, such as watching the sun rising.

Chosens of the Road are disrespectful, self-serving, and physical abusive to those they do not respect. Often, even the people they do respect are treated only slightly better. Ragnarok isn't for the weak.

The main teachings of the Road are that those who settled down are weak and deserving of being plundered by the strong. Protection of one's blood relatives, be they Kindred or kine, is also praised among the followers of the Road. Special protection is levied to one's anda, or "blood-brother", a tradition among the Mongols that Cainites often enhance with a willing blood bond of both parties.
Personal honor is paramount to the leaders of the Anda, but honor on the battlefield is seen as weakening oneself. A Khan fought to survive and would use every method he had available.

The Via Hyron is the original road that most Baali followed. But in time, many younger members of the bloodline devoted themselves to the teachings of the Via Diabolis, much to the dismay of their elders. The Via Hyron is not infernal, but seeks to turn profanity and evil against creation's enemies, by instrumentalizing them to keep the Sleepers from awakening.
Secret among secrets, the Angels are the only guardians of this world against the horrors of the Children...

Followers of Via Bestiae control their Beast through the primal concepts of survival, strength, and individuality. Many members of the Road of the Beast choose a simple, animalistic existence to best serve the beliefs of Via Bestiae, while others follow it by living a simplistic existence, akin to barbarians.
The Lorekeepers gather the knowledge and traditions of Via Bestiae and keeps them safe and circulating among the Ferals.
Followers of Via Regalis control their Beast by ruling over others. Mortals are inferior, promises will be fulfilled, and power is everything.
The true Kings and Queens of Via Regalis are paragon of virtue, duty and honor.

Followers of Via Caeli attempt to control their Beast through religious devotion. To follow the Road of Heaven basically means that any Noddist will love and serve God, follow and obey the rules already laid out by Him (the Ten Commandments being a prime example), and will not act in ways that empower the Devil.
The leaders of the Via Caeli are teachers, holy men and exemplars of what a faithful Cainite should aspire to be.

Being an inherently destructive Road, Via Diabolis was not considered a path to be taken lightly, those who dared followed it indulged themselves with all manner of debauchery and destruction. Many were not really evil per se, so much as believing a virtuous unlife was a fruitless pursuit. Some, however, took the role of devil seriously, even calling themselves devils incarnate and servants of Satan.
Abominations among abominations, the Devils want only on thing : Watch the world burn.
Followers of Via Humanitatis use the human condition to fight their Beast, remembering that they were ordinary mortals before being bestowed with Caine's curse.
The Ashen Prodigal are the heirs of the Pact of Athens, the exalted conclave that lays foundation to the Via.
You wish to join the society?
Adherence to a secret supernatural sect
This covenant makes claim to be the aristocracy of the night
Covenant seeks to influence Kindred society with the strictures of Longinus, who is believed to have been turned into one of the Damned by the very blood of Christ
Vampires who believe the mother of Longinus was also a vampire.  A syncretic heretical merger of the Testament of Longinus with the Circle of the Crone
Covenant of vampires who secretly hunt vampires
Kindred who follow the Testament of Longinus
Cala Senecta: the Wing of Ancients. The leadership and nobility of the Camarilla. This is also the name of the voting governmental body which mirrors the Roman Senate of the mortals.
The Legio Mortuum: The Legion of the Dead, the Camarilla's military arm and strongest means of maintaining its traditions.
Cala Vaticinium: The Wing of Prophets.  The Cult of Augurs are the dark priesthood of the Camarilla connecting the vampires to the Roman gods and keeping Rome in their good graces.

Cala Hospitia: the Wing of Strangers.  Foreigners are not shunned from the Camarilla, but they will never be made full citizens until they fully adopt Roman customs and law. Outsiders band together in this low-caste wing
Monotheistic vampires in the Abrahamic traditions of the Levant
Covenant venerates a variety of female figures as an amalgamated creator of vampires, the Mother of all Monsters
The Blood Blessed of the Celts
The Sacred People of the Saxons, the Woods-Witches
Not a covenant at all, but rather individuals who are independent
These kindred believe they are the daughters of Mara, the demon who tempted the Budhha.
These kindred are the inversion of Jainist beliefs.
The indigenous kindred covenant of Africa.
Noble vampire clans of Europe: Brujah, Cappadocian, Lasombra, Toreador and Ventrue
The Ventrue high clan of vampires
The Toreador high clan of vampires
The Brujah high clan of vampires
The Lasombra high clan of vampires
The Cappadocian high clan of vampires
The Salubri high clan of vampires
The rabble vampire clans of Europe: Gangrel, Malkavian and Nosferatu
Vampire rebels against their established order
Vampire Brujah who want to recreate Carthage where kindred and kine live in harmony

column3: a covenant of vampires who have rebelled against their sires

column2: Warlocks who have become vampires through sorcery
Scions of It√ºgen. The Gangrel bloodline of Dobrul the Brave, found among Mongols and other Altaic peoples
Odin's brood, the All-High's chosen warriors of Ragnarok, Norse Gangrel vampires
Children of the Midnight Sun, Gangrel vampires among the Finnish and Uguric peoples

The Order of Moloch (also referred to as the Molochim) is an organization of the Baali descended from one of the three progenitors, Moloch. Their goal is to keep the "Sleepers", enormous infernal creatures of the Outer Dark from before Creation, bound. To this end, they often violently clash with other infernalists, including other Baali.
Not all Camarilla vampires are of the seven clans
The Sword of Caine, formed by Anarchs who refused to submit to the Camarilla
The hidden ones, a reclusive sect of Roman vampires
The Oradea League is made up of Old Clan Tzimisce who refuse to join the Sabbat or the Camarilla
Vampires outside of sect or clan
Beastial werewolves who want no company with man
Banished from Egypt by the curse of Sutekh, these werewolves wander the deserts
Mongrel werewolves found in city slums
Spread from the Eurasian Steppes to the lands of Hungary, Slavs and the Balkans

The Nameless are a collection of factions and cabals of apostates that refused the authority of the Diamond Orders and rebelled against them. After making peace, the Nameless then formed the Free Council, turning the Diamond into a Pentacle. Most of the Nameless who did not join the Free Council were destroyed, though many pockets remain.

The Adamantine Arrow are an order of mages that claim descent from members of the Ungula Draconis (Claw of the Dragon) who protected the shards of fallen Atlantis. They are the most militaristic of the Diamond Orders and act as defenders to the legitimate heirs of Atlantis.

The Guardians of the Veil are an order of mages that claim descent from members of the Visus Draconis (Eye of the Dragon). They act as the enforcers, secret police, and spies for the Lex Magica and Consilii that hold its tenets.

The Mysterium are an order of mages that claim descent from members of the Alae Draconis (Dragon's Wing), the research and development branch of Atlantean society. Now they seek to reclaim the lore lore of the world and remember the lessons of fallen Atlantis.

The Silver Ladder are an order of mages that claim descent from Atlantean priests and viziers known as the Vox Draconis (Dragon's Voice). They believe in mankind's inherent right to divinity and magic.

Mammon, the Feeder of Greed or Gushasu-Nihur, is one of the nine Maeljin (powerful spirits who rule over a plane of spirits known as the Shadow). He appears as a skeletal angel with pale skin and bat wings. He plagues any Cahalith near his Wounds with visions of want and hunger.

The Father is one of the four Archigenitor Exarchs, the main rulers of the Fallen World. He grants his servants power over Doctrine and his Ministry is Paternoster. The Father is the Exarch of Prime and is considered by his followers to be the origin of revealed religion.

Panopitcon is an organization of technocrats created by Control itself. It's main purpose is to enforce Control's directives and keep the Traditions (the Technocrats' rivals) fractured and broken. A secondary task is the silent enforcement of the assimilation of reality and the destruction of threatening Reality Deviants.

The Scelesti, or the Accursed, are mages who chose to gain power through service to the Abyss, their souls tainted by allowing the void to merge with them. Due to this, they are often perceived as mad and often executed.
The Timori are mages that steal mana from other mages in order to become immortal. This has the disadvantage of causing an intense addiction and turning them into living corpses.
An Orphan is a mage who has learned magic without a formal tutor. They are often prejudiced as loose cannons and threats to those around them.
The Valdaermen are Nordic practitioners of rune magic.

The Order of Hermes is one of the pillars of the Traditions. They were Founded in 767 in an event known as the Pax Hermetica. Obsessed with perfection, they are easily the most hierarchical and prestigious of the Traditions.
The Messianic Voices' paradigm was built on a Foundation of Divinity (Relationship to the Divine), which empowered the Singers to call on the aid of four Archangels.
The Nif'ur en'Daah (Eaters of the Weak) are an Infernalist sect of mages.

The Bone Monks began as the custodians of the Black Abbey of the early Lancea et Sanctum, cleaning up after Blood sacrifices and eventually disposing of victims of sloppy feedings.  Osites seek to derive spiritual understanding of the Requiem by studying that which God has withheld from the Damned: Death. Osites regard funerary rites as fascinating cultural and occult events
column3: they examine corpses, cemeteries, morgues and churchyards for evidence of what lies beyond the mortal coil.

column2: The Mystikoi are a heretical bloodline of Gangrels who pursue enlightenment through communion with the Beast. The roots of the bloodline lay in Albania, where a dualistic heresy influenced by Gnosticism and Manicheanism arose near the end of the first millennium. These heretics were eventually welcomed into Byzantium, and the Kindred among them were mostly converted by the Lancea et Sanctum. A couple of holdouts, however, were granted permission to continue their philosophical studies.

When Invictus Kindred are threatened and trouble looms from without, it is the Knights of the Most Honorable Order of the Thorned Wreath who inevitably step to the fore and defend the Kindred. Professional soldiers and rescue specialists bound by a strict oath of humble self-sacrifice, these Knights are feared and admired in equal proportion.
The Grand Master of the Most Honorable Order of the Thorned Wreath acts as the commander of the Invictus most dangerous militant order.

The Knights of the Black Cross, die Ritter vom (von dem) Schwarzen Kreuze. a secret Cainite order within the ranks of the Teutonic Knights, named for the Black Cross of the Teutonic Order. It was founded by Ventrue Lord J√ºrgen von Verden, lieutenant and childe of mighty Hardestadt.
Grand Master of the Knights of the Black Cross

Most cults break Lilith down to fundamental principles: To pain and creation. To create, one must hurt and be hurt. This is the fundamental principle of life itself. Those who create with pure abandon and celebrate the wet and fleshy acts of creation will invariably be betrayed by those too afraid or otherwise unable to create, like Caine did to Lilith.
The matriarchal term for a paragon of Lilith represent Cainites having achieved the Mother's dream, a balance of creation and destruction.

Formed during 1125 from a group of travelling noble knights who were on their way to join the Crusade, the Knights were known for their skillful and artistic crafted armors and weapons. A group of devotees of the Cainite Heresy and dedicated to protect their angel -who is in fact a Toreador Methuselah--Andrew
Grand Master of the Knights of the Sable Rose
The Nosferatu of St. Ladre or St. Lazarus arose out of an auxiliary order of leper knights that were forced to retire from the Templars and the Hospitallers of St. John.
Grand Master of the Knights of the Saint Ladre
A Cainite order dedicated to hunting down and preserving the true relics and proof of God's existence.
Grand Master of the Knights of the Bitter Ashes
The Order of the True Knights of the Setting Sun is institution of followers of the Via Humanitatis that hunts Wights.
Grand Master of the Knights of the Twilight Order

The Eternal Senate was a council of Cainites modeled after the Roman Senate (albeit much smaller), to govern, legislate and rule over the Roman Empire.  Refounded by Julia Antasia in Frankfurt, county of Mainz.

The Crimson Curia leads the Cainite Heresy was a heretical belief during the Dark Ages that was practiced mainly by Christian Cainites, mostly but not exclusively by Lasombra vampires. It is steeped heavy in Gnosticism and counted with a flock of human priests and clerics.
The Archbishop of Nod is the head of the Crimson Curia, the ruling body of the Cainite Heresy on Earth. The rest of the Curia is composed of the Bishops of Nod.
These preaching friars server as the couriers, scribes, scholars, clerks and missionaries of the Cainite Heresy.
The Conversus of the Order of St. Panteleimon

In an effort to convince the court of my commitment to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], I have gone to [Root.GetHouseOfWorship]. A [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] eyes me warily as I walk up the steps and enter the building. May [Root.TrueReligion.GetHighGodName] forgive me, but I need to make a good impression here.
column3: Dans un effort visant √† convaincre la Cour de mon engagement envers [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], je suis devant l'entr√©e [Root.GetHouseOfWorshipDuDela] pour laisser une offrande √† l'autel des dieux. Un [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] me regarde avec m√©fiance alors que je gravis les marches et entre dans le b√¢timent. Que [Root.TrueReligion.GetHighGodName] me pardonne, mais je dois faire bonne impression ici.
column4: Um den Hof von meiner Hingabe zu [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] zu √ºberzeugen, bin ich zum/zur [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] gegangen, um am Altar der G√∂tter eine Opfergabe darzubringen. Ein/e [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] schaut mich misstrauisch an, als ich die Stufen hinaufsteige und das Geb√§ude betrete. M√∂ge [Root.TrueReligion.GetHighGodName] mir vergeben, aber ich muss hier einen guten Eindruck machen.
column6: En un intento de convencer a la corte de mi compromiso con [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], he ido al templo para hacer una ofrenda en el altar de los dioses. El religioso me observa con recelo mientras subo los pelda√±os y entro en el edificio. Que [Root.TrueReligion.GetHighGodName] me perdone, pero debo dar una buena impresi√≥n.

column2: The Beast has been roaring inside me lately. I can use my commitment to my road to focus myself, and, hopefully, get some much needed clarity of mind.
I am stronger than it will ever be.
You will receive a powerful artifact worthy of such a mastery of the Road.
Finally, I can consider myself a master of my Road. No longer will the Beast have free reins over me. A powerful memento seems in order to celebrate this event.
I am in control of my own fate.
One of the rare copies of the Pact of Athens, the founding text of Via Humanitatis
Attempt to get closer to your human self

Subdue the Beast by being relentless in your rulership duties.

It has been so long since I have indulged myself... Let's get the party started !

Ivar, childe of Canarl, was a master blacksmith and gifted many weapons to the Chosen of Odin.

The Earth Goddess taught us many secrets. But the secrets of War are the most important of all in our current situation.
